derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English denn, of Germanic origin; related to German Tenne 'threshing floor', also to dene

entry.tran: (狮子、狐狸等野生动物的)兽穴，兽窝
entry.def: A den is the home of certain types of wild animals such as lions or foxes.

entry.tran: (家里用来学习、工作或从事业余爱好的)书房，私室
entry.def: Your den is a quiet room in your house where you can go to study, work, or carry on a hobby without being disturbed.

entry.tran: (通常指为了从事非法活动的)秘密聚集处，窝点，巢穴
entry.def: A den is a secret place where people meet, usually for a dishonest purpose.

example.ex: I could provide you with the addresses of at least three illegal drinking dens.
example.tran: 我可以为你提供至少 3 处非法饮酒窝点的地址。
美国城市中的可卡因毒窟

entry.tran: (某一不良行为或非法活动的猖獗)场所，渊薮
entry.def: If you describe a place as a den of a particular type of bad or illegal behaviour, you mean that a lot of that type of behaviour goes on there.

example.ex: ...the one-bedroomed flat that was to become his den of savage debauchery.
example.tran: 即将成为他野蛮放荡之所的一居室公寓

means.word_mean: 2. a hiding place; usually a remote place used by outlaws
3. a unit of 8 to 10 cub scouts
4. a room that is comfortable and secluded
